DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Alteration Calvarial Bone Remodeling Absent Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether a calvarial remodeling is absent or present.  Calvarial remodeling is defined as visible erosion/remodeling of inner table of skull (possibly a secondary sign of slow growth).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change._A change resulting in something that is different from the original._Of or pertaining to the skullcap._A concomitant process in which old bone is resorbed and new bone is formed. Bone remodeling occurs primarily in bone and involves two types of cells, osteoblasts and osteoclasts. Osteoblasts synthesize bone matrix and form new bone while osteoclasts digest mineral matrix and old bone.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A change resulting in something that is different from the original.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The act or process of modifying something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the skullcap.:A concomitant process in which old bone is resorbed and new bone is formed. Bone remodeling occurs primarily in bone and involves two types of cells, osteoblasts and osteoclasts. Osteoblasts synthesize bone matrix and form new bone while osteoclasts digest mineral matrix and old bone.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the skullcap.

A concomitant process in which old bone is resorbed and new bone is formed. Bone remodeling occurs primarily in bone and involves two types of cells, osteoblasts and osteoclasts. Osteoblasts synthesize bone matrix and form new bone while osteoclasts digest mineral matrix and old bone.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
